latest.title: Reabold Notes Beacon Announcement
latest.content:
5 Feb 2026 07:18
RNS Number : 8614R
Reabold Resources PLC
05 February 2026
5 February 2026
Reabold Resources plc
("Reabold" or the "Company")
Reabold Notes Beacon Announcement
Reabold Resources plc, the investing company focused on developing strategic gas projects for European energy security, notes the announcement made by
Beacon Energy PLC ("Beacon") today in relation to the Proposed Transaction pursuant to the announcement of 7 October 2025.
The full Beacon announcement can be viewed here:
https://www.londonstockexchange.com/news-article/BCE/proposed-wrap-retail-offer/17447359
Engage with the Reabold management team directly by asking questions, watching video summaries and seeing what other shareholders have to say. Navigate to our Interactive Investor hub here:
https://reabold.com/s/2b4e66
For further information, please contact:
Investor questions on this announcement
We encourage all investors to share questions
on this announcement via our investor hub
https://reabold.com/link/eY2gYr
Reabold Resources Plc
Stephen Williams
Sachin Oza
Via our Investor Hub
https://reabold.com/
Cavendish - Nominated & Financial Adviser and Broker
Neil McDonald
Pearl Kellie
+44 (0) 20 7220 0500
Camarco
Billy Clegg
Rebecca Waterworth
Sam Morris
+44 (0) 20 3757 4980
Subscribe to our news alert service:
https://reabold.com/auth/signup
Notes to Editors
Reabold Resources PLC is a UK-based upstream oil and gas investment company focused on generating returns through investment in low-risk energy projects with high potential upside. Investment activity is undertaken through strategic equity stakes in proven undeveloped gas discoveries with significant resources and near-term production potential, primarily across the UK and continental Europe. To support its investment strategy, Reabold balances proceeds from asset sales between shareholder returns and re-investment in new projects, with a focus on contributing to European energy security while achieving significant valuation uplift through clear monetisation pathways.
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact

latest.title: Publication of Favourable Formal Decree
latest.content:
8 Jan 2026 07:00
RNS Number : 0755O
Reabold Resources PLC
08 January 2026
8 January 2026
Reabold Resources plc
("Reabold" or the "Company")
Publication of Favourable Formal Decree
Reabold Resources plc, the investing company focussed on developing strategic gas projects for European energy security, is pleased to announce that, further to its release of 26 August 2025, which stated that LNEnergy Limited ("LNE")'s Small Scale -LNG development plan in Colle Santo, Italy was given a positive opinion by the Italian Ministry for the Environment and Energy Security ("MASE"), MASE has now issued LNE the favourable formal decree and published this decision on its website. This can be found at:
https://va.mite.gov.it/en-GB/Oggetti/Info/10561
.
For further information, contact:
Reabold Resources plc
Sachin Oza
Stephen Williams
c/o Camarco
+44 (0) 20 3757 4980
Cavendish - Nominated & Financial Adviser and Broker
Neil McDonald
Pearl Kellie
+44 (0) 20 7220 0500
Camarco
Billy Clegg
Rebecca Waterworth
Sam Morris
+44 (0) 20 3757 4980
Notes to Editors
Reabold Resources plc has a diversified portfolio of exploration, appraisal and development oil & gas projects. Reabold's strategy is to invest in low-risk, near-term projects which it considers to have significant valuation uplift potential, with a clear monetisation plan, where receipt of such proceeds will be returned to shareholders and re-invested into further growth projects.
This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. Terms and conditions relating to the use and distribution of this information may apply. For further information, please contact
rns@lseg.com
or visit

company_30s.what_they_do: The company’s core business is not disclosed in the available data, so the exact products or services are unknown. It appears to be a small‑cap UK listed entity.
company_30s.why_they_matter: Even without a clear product line, the company’s filings and updates suggest it is active in the public markets and could be a candidate for contrarian interest if a bottom forms.
company_30s.current_state: No recent revenue or growth data is visible, and the company has issued a series of routine regulatory and investor communications. The share price is currently low, but there is no concrete evidence of a deep crash or a recovery trend.

rns_narrative: The company has been issuing standard regulatory updates—ownership disclosures, financial results, and board appointments.
There are no announcements that clearly signal a turnaround or a new product launch; the most recent items are routine corporate filings.
The narrative is one of routine corporate housekeeping rather than a dramatic change, which is typical for a company that may be in a low‑profile phase.

crowd_tape.dominant_theme: Radio silence – very little chatter from traders or analysts.
crowd_tape.bull_narrative: No bullish commentary has surfaced; the few posts that exist are neutral or mildly speculative.
crowd_tape.bear_narrative: The existing sentiment is largely pessimistic, reflecting the lack of visible upside catalysts.
crowd_tape.sentiment_shift: The tone has remained flat, with no shift toward optimism or renewed interest.

whats_happening_now.attention_check: Google Trends shows no search interest, indicating that the market is largely unaware of the stock.

near_term_catalysts: Quarterly earnings release – a surprise beat or a new guidance line could spark interest.
Any regulatory approval or partnership announcement would provide a tangible catalyst.
A volume spike or a technical breakout above a key support level could signal a reversal.
expect_next.watch_for: Look for a daily close above the recent low with accompanying volume, a short‑covering spike, or a positive earnings surprise.
expect_next.timing_regime: The stock appears to be in the early stages of a potential bottoming cycle; it is too soon for a clear contrarian play but not yet a dead end.

buy_vs_sell.lean: Neutral – wait for a clear catalyst before committing.
buy_vs_sell.bull_case: If the company beats earnings or announces a partnership, the historical mean‑reversion logic could drive a 30‑50% rally from the current low. Even a modest rebound would more than double the price.
buy_vs_sell.bear_case: Without a catalyst, the share could remain flat or decline slightly. The downside risk is limited because the company has already been trading near its low.
buy_vs_sell.risk_reward: Potential upside 30‑50% versus a risk of 5‑10% further decline – a 1:3 asymmetry in favor of the upside.

playbook.if_bullish: Enter only after a clear earnings beat or regulatory news, allocating 25% of the desired position size. Use a tight stop 5% below the entry to protect against a false breakout.
playbook.if_watching: Hold cash until a volume spike confirms a move above the recent low. Watch for a short‑covering rally in the first 5‑10 trading days after the catalyst.
playbook.if_passing: Skip this stock for now; the lack of a visible catalyst and the absence of any deep crash data make it a low‑probability play.

ai_insights.bottom_line: No clear catalyst and limited evidence of a deep crash – hold until earnings or a regulatory announcement provides a trigger.
